action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: I will start with a common five-letter word that includes a variety of vowels and consonants to gather initial feedback.
guess: crane

attempts = 1
target_word = tubal
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<yellow> n<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<yellow> n<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that "a" is in the word but in the wrong position. I will choose a new word that includes "a" in a different position and excludes the letters "c", "r", "n", and "e".
guess: salty

attempts = 2
target_word = tubal
guess = salty
guess_feedback = s<red> a<yellow> l<yellow> t<yellow> y<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> a<yellow> l<yellow> t<yellow> y<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "a", "l", and "t" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will choose a new word that includes these letters in different positions and excludes "s" and "y".
guess: altar

attempts = 3
target_word = tubal
guess = altar
guess_feedback = a<red> l<yellow> t<yellow> a<green> r<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> l<yellow> t<yellow> a<green> r<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that the second "a" is correct and in the right position, while "l" and "t" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will choose a new word that places "a" in the fourth position and includes "l" and "t" in different positions, excluding "r".
guess: plait

attempts = 4
target_word = tubal
guess = plait
guess_feedback = p<red> l<yellow> a<yellow> i<red> t<yellow>

guess_feedback: p<red> l<yellow> a<yellow> i<red> t<yellow>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback shows that "l", "a", and "t" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will choose a new word that includes these letters in different positions and excludes "p" and "i".
guess: atlas

attempts = 5
target_word = tubal
guess = atlas
guess_feedback = a<red> t<yellow> l<yellow> a<green> s<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> t<yellow> l<yellow> a<green> s<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The feedback indicates that the second "a" is correct and in the right position, while "t" and "l" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will choose a new word that places "a" in the fourth position and includes "t" and "l" in different positions, excluding "s".
guess: total

attempts = 6
target_word = tubal
guess = total
guess_feedback = t<green> o<red> t<red> a<green> l<green>

guess_explanation: I will start with a common five-letter word that includes a variety of vowels and consonants to gather initial feedback.
The feedback indicates that "a" is in the word but in the wrong position. I will choose a new word that includes "a" in a different position and excludes the letters "c", "r", "n", and "e".
The feedback shows that "a", "l", and "t" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will choose a new word that includes these letters in different positions and excludes "s" and "y".

The feedback indicates that the second "a" is correct and in the right position, while "l" and "t" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will choose a new word that places "a" in the fourth position and includes "l" and "t" in different positions, excluding "r".
The feedback shows that "l", "a", and "t" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will choose a new word that includes these letters in different positions and excludes "p" and "i".

The feedback indicates that the second "a" is correct and in the right position, while "t" and "l" are in the word but in the wrong positions. I will choose a new word that places "a" in the fourth position and includes "t" and "l" in different positions, excluding "s".
